page.title: 06Laverstock Church Activities
page.content: St Andrew's Church has developed a scheme of{neighbourhood watch and {help.}Volunteers act as Street Stewards. They are appointed and commisioned by the vicar. They are people whose task is to help others in their neighbourhood street, assigned to them. When someone new moves in they might welcome them and invite the newcomer in to the fellowship of the community. They will also look out for the needs of the elderly in the area. There are at present a total of forty one{Street Stewards,}covering nearly all roads in the parish. The active{Sunday School}caters for children four to twelve years and meets in the village hall. The{Youth Fellowship}provides for the religious instruction for teenagers and recreational games such as darts, snooker,table tenis and volley ball.
